overview.title: Project Overview
description: As part of a group project at InHolland, I led the development of a comprehensive web application for the fictional "Haarlem Festival" event. This project, named "The Festival," encompassed three distinct events: Yummy (a food festival), DANCE! (a dance festival), and A Stroll Through History (a cultural/historic event). The primary goal was to create a full-stack web application that would allow users to explore event details, make reservations, and purchase tickets.

As the project leader, I was responsible for overseeing the entire development process, ensuring cohesion between different components, and directly contributing to key features. My primary focus areas were the Yummy event, designing and maintaining the database structure, and the entire ticket registration and payment process, including the integration of the Mollie payment system.

designProcess.title: Design Process
designProcess.description: The project began with a comprehensive design phase, where our team worked on creating a user-friendly and visually appealing interface for the Haarlem Festival website. We aimed to develop a fresh and inclusive design that would attract a diverse audience to Haarlem and its events.
steps: Creating a consistent visual identity across different event pages while maintaining each event's unique character.
Developing a mobile-friendly design, with special consideration for younger users (ages 8-12) for the mobile version.
Implementing intuitive navigation and clear information architecture to help users easily find event details and make reservations.
Designing user-friendly interfaces for the ticket booking and payment processes.

technicalImplementation.title: Technical Implementation
technicalImplementation.description: The web application was primarily developed using PHP, with a MySQL database managed through phpMyAdmin. The frontend was created using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, with Bootstrap for responsive design. As project leader, I implemented a MVC architecture and ensured the team adhered to PSR standards and OOP principles.
features: User Authentication: Implemented a secure login system with password hashing and recovery functionality.
Shopping Cart: Created a robust cart system allowing users to add and manage their event tickets and reservations.
Payment Integration: Implemented the Mollie payment gateway for secure online transactions, including webhook handling for payment confirmations.
Email Support: Utilized PHPMailer for sending confirmation emails and tickets to users.
QR Code Generation: Integrated QR code generation for tickets and a QR scanner for event check-ins.
Admin Panel: An administrative interface for event management and user control.
Responsive Design: Ensured the website was fully responsive across various devices.

developmentProcess.title: Development Process
developmentProcess.description: The development process began with setting up a Docker environment for consistent development and deployment across our team. Composer was introduced for dependency management, which included packages like mpdf, PHPMailer, and Mollie API.
steps: Architecting the overall structure of the application, including database schema design and extending routing functionality.
Creating database tables for users, events, tickets, reservations, ensuring proper relationships and efficient data retrieval.
Conducting regular code reviews and helping team members overcome technical challenges.
Ensuring smooth integration of all project components.

results.title: Results and Learnings
results.description: This project significantly enhanced my skills in full-stack web development and project management. It provided hands-on experience with integrating third-party APIs, handling secure payments, and developing a scalable web application. The challenges faced, especially in implementing complex features like the shopping cart and payment system, greatly improved my problem-solving abilities and deepened my understanding of web technologies. Leading this project also honed my skills in team coordination, task delegation, and effective communication in a development environment.
